translated: The perfection of wisdom that arises from compassion is the absence of weariness in order to purify the lower realms, the absence of weariness in order to give the gift of the Dharma, and the absence of weariness in order to ripen beings.

original: 'di dag ni snying rjes yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
analyzed: 'di dag ni snying rjes yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
translated: These are the six perfections that are dedicated by compassion.

original: de la dga' bas yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dga' bas yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six perfections that are dedicated by joy?

original: mchog tu dga' ba sngon du 'gro ba'i sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni dga' ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba sngon du 'gro ba'i sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni dga' ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of generosity of joy is the generosity that is preceded by supreme joy.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa'i sgrub pa'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni dga' ba'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa'i sgrub pa'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni dga' ba'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of morality of joy is the morality of one who is very relaxed.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa las byung ba'i bzod pa gang yin pa de ni dga' ba la dmigs @72b pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa las byung ba'i bzod pa gang yin pa de ni dga' ba la dmigs @72b pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of patience focused on joy is the patience that comes from a sense of shame and a sense of decency.

original: gnod sems med par bdag dang gzhan bde bar byed la /üîΩnyes par mi sems shing legs par sems pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / gdung ba med pa gang yin pa de ni dga' ba la dmigs pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gnod sems med par bdag dang gzhan bde bar byed la / nyes par mi sems shing legs par sems pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / gdung ba med pa gang yin pa de ni dga' ba la dmigs pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of effort focused on joy is the effort of one who, without malice, makes both self and other happy,üîΩwho is not ill-willed but well-willed, and who is without regret and remorse.

original: mi dga' ba rab tu zhe bar 'gyur ba dang / sems rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / kun nas dkris pa sel bar 'gyur ba dang / 'dod chags spong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni dga' ba la dmigs pa'i bsam gtan kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: mi dga' ba rab tu zhe bar 'gyur ba dang / sems rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / kun nas dkris pa sel bar 'gyur ba dang / 'dod chags spong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni dga' ba la dmigs pa'i bsam gtan kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of meditation focused on joy is the meditation of one who, not delighting in non-joy, has a purified mind, who dispels the envelopments, and who abandons passion.

original: btang snyoms byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su bzung zhing chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis gnas zhi ba thogs pa med pa phyin ci ma
analyzed: btang snyoms byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su bzung zhing chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis gnas zhi ba thogs pa med pa phyin ci ma
translated: He is endowed with the branch of enlightenment of equanimity and is endowed with the branch of enlightenment of the investigation of phenomena. He is endowed with the blessing of the door of liberation of wishlessness, and he is endowed with the unobstructed peace of the absence of conceptualization.

original: log pa gang yin pa de ni dga' ba las byung ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: log pa gang yin pa de ni dga' ba las byung ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom that arises from joy is the unhindered, unerring, unimpeded peace that is the blessing of the gateway to liberation of the absence of wishes, which is endowed with the branch of enlightenment of equanimity and the branch of enlightenment of correct analysis of phenomena.

original: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i dga' bas yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i dga' bas yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
translated: These are the six perfections dedicated by joy.

original: de la btang snyoms kyis yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la btang snyoms kyis yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat are the six perfections dedicated by equanimity?

original: chos mnyam pa nyid kyi rnam par smin pa lam gyi rgyud bcad cing sems ma gtugs pa'i sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms kyis yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: chos mnyam pa nyid kyi rnam par smin pa lam gyi rgyud bcad cing sems ma gtugs pa'i sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms kyis yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of generosity dedicated by equanimity is the generosity of one who has cut the continuum of the path of the ripening of the sameness of phenomena and whose mind is not disturbed.

original: gdung ba med cing snying brtse ba'i @73a *//
analyzed: gdung ba med cing snying brtse ba'i @73a *//
translated: Without distress, with compassion,üîΩ

original: sems kyi shin tu sbyangs pa byang chub kyi yan lag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms kyis yongs su bsngos pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi shin tu sbyangs pa byang chub kyi yan lag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms kyis yongs su bsngos pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of morality associated with the limb of enlightenment of mental fitness, which is free from distress and full of loving-kindness, is the perfection of morality dedicated by means of equanimity.

original: sems mi brkam zhing mtshan ma med pa mngon par bsgrubs la phyi dang nang la dpyod pa ltad mo spangs pa'i bzod pa gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms kyis yongs su bsngos pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sems mi brkam zhing mtshan ma med pa mngon par bsgrubs la phyi dang nang la dpyod pa ltad mo spangs pa'i bzod pa gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms kyis yongs su bsngos pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of patience of one who is not greedy, who has accomplished the signless, and who has abandoned the spectacle of the investigation of the internal and external, is the perfection of patience dedicated by means of equanimity.

original: 'dus byas kyi ngo bo kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i btang snyoms gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms kyis yongs su bsngos pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi ngo bo kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i btang snyoms gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms kyis yongs su bsngos pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of vigor of one who is equanimous, who is fully aware of the nature of the compounded, is the perfection of vigor dedicated by means of equanimity.

original: zhi gnas sngon du 'gro zhing lhag mthong gi stobs bskyed pa thams cad du 'gro ba'i bsam gtan gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms kyis yongs su bsngos pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas sngon du 'gro zhing lhag mthong gi stobs bskyed pa thams cad du 'gro ba'i bsam gtan gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms kyis yongs su bsngos pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of meditative concentration that is dedicated by means of equanimity is the meditative concentration that is preceded by meditative serenity, and that is the means of developing the power of insight.

original: snying rje chen po la dmigs pa'i mthar phyin pa lam shin tu sbyangs pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms kyis yongs su bsngos pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po la dmigs pa'i mthar phyin pa lam shin tu sbyangs pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms kyis yongs su bsngos pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom that is dedicated by means of equanimity is the wisdom that is the culmination of the focus on great compassion, and that is the path of thorough training.

original: 'di dag ni btang snyoms kyis yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
analyzed: 'di dag ni btang snyoms kyis yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
translated: These are the six perfections that are dedicated by means of equanimity.

original: de la log par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la log par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six perfections that are dedicated by means of wrong views?

original: dper na / bram @73b ze bel mchu 'gram gnas yangs pa na gzhan yongs su smin par bya ba dang mthun par mchod sbyin byed pa gang yin pa de ni log par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: dper na / bram @73b ze bel mchu 'gram gnas yangs pa na gzhan yongs su smin par bya ba dang mthun par mchod sbyin byed pa gang yin pa de ni log par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: For example, a Brahmin who performs a sacrifice in a wide place near the bank of the Bel River, in accordance with the ripening of others, is the perfection of giving dedicated by wrong views.

original: dmigs pa can gyi tshul khrims de byed cing spyod la bdag tu 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni log par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa can gyi tshul khrims de byed cing spyod la bdag tu 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni log par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The morality of the one who practices and engages in the morality of the one with an object of reference, and whatever is held to be the self, is the perfection of morality dedicated by wrong views.

original: brtul zhugs kyi gnas kyi nags tshal yangs pa na skyo ba med par spyod pa gang yin pa de ni log par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs kyi gnas kyi nags tshal yangs pa na skyo ba med par spyod pa gang yin pa de ni log par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The conduct in the wide forest of the site of austerities, without weariness, is the perfection of patience dedicated by wrong views.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bya ba rnams sgrub cing rig byed kyang rtogs la cha lugs des gzhan yongs su smin par byed pa gang yin pa de ni log par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bya ba rnams sgrub cing rig byed kyang rtogs la cha lugs des gzhan yongs su smin par byed pa gang yin pa de ni log par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of effort of one who, in the guise of a brahmin, accomplishes worldly activities, understands the Vedas, and brings others to spiritual maturity through that guise, but who is dedicated to wrong views, is the perfection of effort dedicated to wrong views.

original: bsam gtan bskyed pas de'i ngo bo la gnas shing des mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa de ni log par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bskyed pas de'i ngo bo la gnas shing des mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa de ni log par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of meditation of one who, by generating meditation, abides in its essence and delights in it, but who is dedicated to wrong views, is the perfection of meditation dedicated to wrong views.

original: bram ze'i cha lugs kyis sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed cing rjes su mthun par 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni log par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: bram ze'i cha lugs kyis sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed cing rjes su mthun par 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni log par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom of one who, in the guise of a brahmin, brings sentient beings to spiritual maturity and engages in accordance with them, but who is dedicated to wrong views, is the perfection of wisdom dedicated to wrong views.

original: 'di dag ni log par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /üîΩde la @74a *//
analyzed: 'di dag ni log par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /üîΩde la @74a *//
translated: These are the six perfections dedicated to wrong views.

original: yang dag pa'i lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang yin zhe na /üîΩ'jig rten pa'i bya ba la 'jug cing sbyin pa yod do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang yin zhe na / 'jig rten pa'i bya ba la 'jug cing sbyin pa yod do //
translated: What are the six perfections dedicated by right view?

original: mchod sbyin yod do //
analyzed: mchod sbyin yod do //
translated: There is giving,üîΩthere is sacrifice,

original: sbyin sreg yod do //
analyzed: sbyin sreg yod do //
translated: there is burnt offering,

original: las legs par byas pa dang / las nyes pa byas pa rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yod do /
analyzed: las legs par byas pa dang / las nyes pa byas pa rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yod do /
translated: there is the fruit of good and bad actions.

original: zhe gang de lta bu'i sems kyis sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'i lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: zhe gang de lta bu'i sems kyis sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'i lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Whatever giving is done with such a mind is the perfection of giving dedicated by right view.

original: sangs rgyas ma byung ba na byang chub sems dpa' sdig pa'i grogs po'i dbang gis sdig pa mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'i lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ma byung ba na byang chub sems dpa' sdig pa'i grogs po'i dbang gis sdig pa mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'i lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: When there is no Buddha, the bodhisattva does not commit evil even under the influence of bad friends. Whatever morality is done is the perfection of morality dedicated by right view.

original: dper na / ri'i rgyal po gangs can la byang chub sems dpa' ne tsor gyur pas shing skam po mi spong ba sngon bdag 'dir dga' bar byas pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'i lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: dper na / ri'i rgyal po gangs can la byang chub sems dpa' ne tsor gyur pas shing skam po mi spong ba sngon bdag 'dir dga' bar byas pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'i lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: For example, the perfection of patience dedicated by right view is like the bodhisattva who was a parrot on the snowy king of mountains, who did not abandon a dry tree, thinking, ‚ÄúThis tree has given me pleasure in the past.‚Äù

original: bdag dang gzhan la gnod par mi byed par zhugs pa'i lta ba ni /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la gnod par mi byed par zhugs pa'i lta ba ni /
translated: The view that one should not harm oneself or others

original: dper na tshong pa aa shu la lta bu gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'i lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: dper na tshong pa aa shu la lta bu gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'i lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: is like the view of the merchant A≈õula. The perfection of effort dedicated by right view is like that.

original: shes rab kyis yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i bsam gtan bzhi thob pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'i lta bas @74b yongs su bsngos pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyis yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i bsam gtan bzhi thob pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'i lta bas @74b yongs su bsngos pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of concentration dedicated by right view is the attainment of the four concentrations purified by wisdom.

original: skye bo mang po la phan pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'i shes rab ni /
analyzed: skye bo mang po la phan pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'i shes rab ni /
translated: Wisdom that abides for the benefit of many beingsüîΩis like the wisdom of the bodhisattva who was a monkey. The perfection of wisdom dedicated by right view is like that.

original: dper na byang chub sems dpa' kun tu rgyu 'di ltar gcig bus tshogs su bcad pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi bkod pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'i lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: dper na byang chub sems dpa' kun tu rgyu 'di ltar gcig bus tshogs su bcad pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi bkod pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'i lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: For example, the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva who is a wandering mendicant, who is alone, and who has set up the eighty-four thousand assemblies, is dedicated by right view.

original: 'di dag ni yang dag pa'i lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
analyzed: 'di dag ni yang dag pa'i lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
translated: These are the six perfections dedicated by right view.

original: de la gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six perfections dedicated by the view of abiding?

original: sangs rgyas ma byung ba na byang chub sems dpa' tha na rmi lam na'ang ser sna'i sems mi bskyed na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ma byung ba na byang chub sems dpa' tha na rmi lam na'ang ser sna'i sems mi bskyed na /
translated: When a Buddha has not arisen, a bodhisattva does not arouse a thought of stinginess, even in a dream.

original: dngos su lta mos kyang ci dgos pa gang yin pa de ni gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos su lta mos kyang ci dgos pa gang yin pa de ni gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: What need is there to mention actually giving? This is the perfection of generosity dedicated by the view of abiding.

original: tha na srog 'gags kyang kha na ma tho ba rdul tsam la'ang bslab pa las mi 'da' ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: tha na srog 'gags kyang kha na ma tho ba rdul tsam la'ang bslab pa las mi 'da' ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Even at the cost of their lives, they do not transgress even the slightest bit of the precepts.üîΩ

original: gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of morality when, even at the cost of one's life, one does not transgress even the slightest bit of the precepts.

original: tshe rabs de dang de dag tu mnga' bdag tu gyur pa na'ang bzod pa'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa yin zhing mnyen pa gang yin pa de ni gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //üîΩtshe rabs thams cad du gzhan gyis bstan pa dang / ma bstan pa byang chub kyi phyir rjes su @75a *//
analyzed: tshe rabs de dang de dag tu mnga' bdag tu gyur pa na'ang bzod pa'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa yin zhing mnyen pa gang yin pa de ni gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o // tshe rabs thams cad du gzhan gyis bstan pa dang / ma bstan pa byang chub kyi phyir rjes su @75a *//
translated: It is the perfection of patience when, in all one's births, one is by nature patient and gentle, and when one is dedicated to patience.

original: ston pa gang yin pa de ni gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa gang yin pa de ni gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of effort when, in all one's births, one is dedicated to the enlightenment of others, whether they are taught by others or not.

original: tshe rabs de dang de dag na legs par bsam pa sems pa yin zhing legs par spyad pa'i las byed la /
analyzed: tshe rabs de dang de dag na legs par bsam pa sems pa yin zhing legs par spyad pa'i las byed la /
translated: It is the perfection of meditation when, in all one's births, one is well-intentioned and does good deeds.

original: de ni shin tu dul ba'i rang bzhin de lta bur gyur pa gang yin pa de ni gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //üîΩslob dpon med par 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bya ba khong du chud na sems can gyi tshogs gzhan la de lta bu'i ye shes de med cing gang gis lus kyi las sems can dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i shes rab kyi
analyzed: de ni shin tu dul ba'i rang bzhin de lta bur gyur pa gang yin pa de ni gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o // slob dpon med par 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bya ba khong du chud na sems can gyi tshogs gzhan la de lta bu'i ye shes de med cing gang gis lus kyi las sems can dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i shes rab kyi
translated: The param ita of m editation ‚Äúdedicated w ith the view of abiding‚Äù is the m editation of one w ho has become such a person of extremely disciplined nature.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ste /üîΩ'di dag ni gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ste / 'di dag ni gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
translated: The param ita of w isdom ‚Äúdedicated w ith the view of abiding‚Äù is the w isdom of one who, w ithout a teacher, has com prehended both worldly and w orldly-transcending activities, and who, because of this, has no such knowledge in the com pany of other sentient beings.üîΩThese are the six param itas dedicated w ith the view of abiding.

original: de la mi gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mi gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: W hat are the six paramitas dedicated w ith the view of non-abiding?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs mkhas pas yongs su zin pa'i sbyin pa gang yin de ni mi gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs mkhas pas yongs su zin pa'i sbyin pa gang yin de ni mi gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of generosity that is embraced by the perfection of wisdom and skillful means is the perfection of generosity that is dedicated with the view of non-abiding.

original: lus dang sems la dmigs pa med pa'i sems kyi sbyin pa gang @75b yin pa de ni mi gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: lus dang sems la dmigs pa med pa'i sems kyi sbyin pa gang @75b yin pa de ni mi gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The generosity of the mind that is without reference to body and mind is the morality that is dedicated with the view of non-abiding.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la bzod pa gang yin pa de ni mi gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la bzod pa gang yin pa de ni mi gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The patience of the irreversible stage is the patience that is dedicated with the view of non-abiding.

original: 'du byed thams cad la mi gnas shing kun nas dkris pa med pa'i rtsol ba gang yin pa de ni mi gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad la mi gnas shing kun nas dkris pa med pa'i rtsol ba gang yin pa de ni mi gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: The effort that is without abiding in all formations and without entanglements is the effort that is dedicated with the view of non-abiding.

original: bdag tu 'du shes kyang med cing bdag med par 'du shes kyang med la /
analyzed: bdag tu 'du shes kyang med cing bdag med par 'du shes kyang med la /
translated: There is no perception of self, nor is there a perception of selflessness.

original: phyi dang nang la mi gnas pa'i bsam gtan gang yin pa de ni mi gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i bsam gtan no /
analyzed: phyi dang nang la mi gnas pa'i bsam gtan gang yin pa de ni mi gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i bsam gtan no /
translated: The concentration that does not dwell internally or externally is the perfection of concentration dedicated by the view of non-dwelling.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos dang ma 'dris pa'i shes rab thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa med pa gang yin pa de ni mi gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos dang ma 'dris pa'i shes rab thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa med pa gang yin pa de ni mi gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o /
translated: The wisdom that is not attached to the omniscience of all the wisdoms that are not familiar with the dharmas of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas is the perfection of wisdom dedicated by the view of non-dwelling.

original: 'di dag ni mi gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
analyzed: 'di dag ni mi gnas par lta bas yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
translated: These are the six perfections dedicated by the view of non-dwelling.

original: de la gnas med par yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /üîΩgang khams gsum la mngon par dga' ba med pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dper na /
analyzed: de la gnas med par yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na / gang khams gsum la mngon par dga' ba med pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dper na /
translated: What are the six perfections dedicated without a basis?üîΩThe perfection of generosity that is not delighted with the three realms, for example,

original: mar me mdzad kyi lta bu gang yin pa de ni gnas med par yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: mar me mdzad kyi lta bu gang yin pa de ni gnas med par yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: like Dƒ´pa·πÉkara, is the perfection of generosity dedicated without a basis.

original: ma gtogs pa'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni gnas med pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: ma gtogs pa'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni gnas med pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality that is not included in the other five perfections is the morality of no-fixed-abode.

original: @76a *// chos thams cad la rlom sems med pa'i sems kyi bzod pa gang yin pa de ni gnas med pa'i bzod pa'o /
analyzed: @76a *// chos thams cad la rlom sems med pa'i sems kyi bzod pa gang yin pa de ni gnas med pa'i bzod pa'o /
translated: The patience of the mind that has no conceit about any dharma is the patience of no-fixed-abode.

original: mi dmigs par spyod pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni gnas med pa'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: mi dmigs par spyod pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni gnas med pa'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: The effort that is practiced without apprehending anything is the effort of no-fixed-abode.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba'i sa thob pa'i phyin ci ma log pa'i bsam gtan gang yin pa de ni gnas med pa'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba'i sa thob pa'i phyin ci ma log pa'i bsam gtan gang yin pa de ni gnas med pa'i bsam gtan no //
translated: The unmistaken concentration of the bodhisattva who has attained the bh≈´mi of seeing is the concentration of no-fixed-abode.

original: nyon mongs pa zad par 'gyur ba'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni gnas med par yongs su bsngos pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zad par 'gyur ba'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni gnas med par yongs su bsngos pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste //
translated: The wisdom that leads to the exhaustion of afflictions is the perfection of wisdom of the dedication of no-fixed-abode.

original: 'di dag ni gnas med par yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
analyzed: 'di dag ni gnas med par yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
translated: These are the six perfections of the dedication of no-fixed-abode.

original: de la nga rgyal gyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nga rgyal gyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat are the six pƒÅramitƒÅs of pride?

original: byang chub sems dpa' nga rgyal gyi bdud bcom nas sbyin pa sbyin par byed cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nga rgyal gyi bdud bcom nas sbyin pa sbyin par byed cing /
translated: The perfection of giving through the defeat of the demon of pride by the bodhisattva,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing phun sum tshogs pa sgrub par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal gyi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing phun sum tshogs pa sgrub par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal gyi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: and the accomplishment of the perfect buddha-field, is the perfection of giving through pride.

original: ngan song gsum sbyong bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal gyi tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ngan song gsum sbyong bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal gyi tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The morality which purifies the three lower realms is the perfection of morality through pride.

original: mtshan rnam par smin par 'gyur ba dang / mdzes par 'gyur ba'i bzod pa gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal gyi bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan rnam par smin par 'gyur ba dang / mdzes par 'gyur ba'i bzod pa gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal gyi bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The patience which is the ripening of the marks and which is beautiful is the perfection of patience through pride.

original: nor bu rin po che'i phyir rgya mtsho chen po skam par spro ba dang / gang gis rang gi @76b chos mngon par 'byung ba'i brtson pa gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal gyi brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che'i phyir rgya mtsho chen po skam par spro ba dang / gang gis rang gi @76b chos mngon par 'byung ba'i brtson pa gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal gyi brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The effort which is the enthusiasm for drying up the great ocean for the sake of the precious jewel, and the effort which is the arising of one's own Dharma, is the perfection of effort through pride.

original: nyon mongs pa zil gyis gnon par 'gyur zhing bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin ye shes skye bar 'gyur ba'i bsam gtan gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal gyi bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zil gyis gnon par 'gyur zhing bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin ye shes skye bar 'gyur ba'i bsam gtan gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal gyi bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The concentration which overcomes the defilements and gives rise to the intuition in accordance with one's thoughts is the perfection of concentration of the pride-possessor.

original: nga rgyal dang / lta ba kun tu 'joms par 'gyur ba'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / lta ba kun tu 'joms par 'gyur ba'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The param ita of w isdom of pride is the w isdom that conquers all pride and views.

original: 'di dag ni nga rgyal gyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
analyzed: 'di dag ni nga rgyal gyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
translated: These are the six param itas of pride.

original: de la bzod pa las byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bzod pa las byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six paramitas that arise from patience?

original: byang chub kyi mthar 'gro ba'i sems kyi sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni bzod pa las byung ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi mthar 'gro ba'i sems kyi sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni bzod pa las byung ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The param ita of giving that arises from patience is the giving of one w ho has the m ind to go to the end of enlightenm ent.

original: dper na bdud kyis sems can dmyal ba bstan pas sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa bsal bar mi nus pa ni sngon gyi tshul las shes par bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bdud kyis sems can dmyal ba bstan pas sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa bsal bar mi nus pa ni sngon gyi tshul las shes par bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the m anner of the past, w here the m ind of giving is not destroyed by the dem on‚Äôs display of the hells.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni bzod pa las byung ba'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni bzod pa las byung ba'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of morality that comes from patience is the morality of one who is irreversible.

original: dper na rgyal po'i bu bsod nams 'od 'phro 'de ltar rnal 'byor la mngon du phyogs pa sbyin pa la dbang du gyur pa zhig byung bas nyi ma gcig pa shing rta dang / rta dang / bzhon pa dang / glang po dang / glang po che dang /üîΩdpag tshad khor yug tsam gyi gdugs dang / mu tig gi do shal phreng ba brgya dang / gos @77a *//
analyzed: dper na rgyal po'i bu bsod nams 'od 'phro 'de ltar rnal 'byor la mngon du phyogs pa sbyin pa la dbang du gyur pa zhig byung bas nyi ma gcig pa shing rta dang / rta dang / bzhon pa dang / glang po dang / glang po che dang / dpag tshad khor yug tsam gyi gdugs dang / mu tig gi do shal phreng ba brgya dang / gos @77a *//
translated: For example, there was a prince named Pu·πáyabala who was so devoted to generosity that he gave away a chariot, horses, vehicles, elephants, and even his own flesh.üîΩHe gave away parasols that covered an area of a yojana in all directions, garlands of pearls,üîΩclothing,

original: sbyin pa dang / rin po che'i cod pan dang / mchil lham stong phrag brgya ri ba dang / bud med stong phrag brgyad cu dang / sil snyan dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor dang / skyed mig tshal dang / mig sbyin pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / rin po che'i cod pan dang / mchil lham stong phrag brgya ri ba dang / bud med stong phrag brgyad cu dang / sil snyan dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor dang / skyed mig tshal dang / mig sbyin pa dang /
translated: jewels, crowns, shoes worth a hundred thousand, eighty thousand women, musical instruments, a royal palace, a pleasure garden, and even his eyes.

original: mgo dang rkang pa bcad nas sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa gang na gang gi bzod pa gang yin pa de ni bzod pa las byung ba'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: mgo dang rkang pa bcad nas sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa gang na gang gi bzod pa gang yin pa de ni bzod pa las byung ba'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The patience that is the patience of one who gives gifts by cutting off his head and limbs is the perfection of patience that comes from patience.

original: mi gnas pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni bzod pa las byung ba'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni bzod pa las byung ba'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The effort that is the effort of one who does not abide in either samsara or nirvana is the perfection of effort that comes from patience.

original: dper na rta'i rgyal po rngog ldan gyis sems can rnams sgrol ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rta'i rgyal po rngog ldan gyis sems can rnams sgrol ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the king of horses, Balahaka, who rescues sentient beings.

original: dge ba'i kha dog can lus kyi mtshan yongs su sbyangs pa las byung ba'i bsam gtan gang yin pa de ni bzod pa las byung ba'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i kha dog can lus kyi mtshan yongs su sbyangs pa las byung ba'i bsam gtan gang yin pa de ni bzod pa las byung ba'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The concentration that comes from the purification of the marks of the body, which is the color of virtue, is the perfection of concentration that comes from patience.

original: dper na dge slong ye shes mchog grong khyer du 'jug pa zhig byung ba 'du shes tha dad du mi byed cing sems mnyam pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni bzod pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: dper na dge slong ye shes mchog grong khyer du 'jug pa zhig byung ba 'du shes tha dad du mi byed cing sems mnyam pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni bzod pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The param ita of w isdom ‚Äúarising from patience‚Äù is the w isdom of the monk Yeshe Chog, who, w hen he entered the city, did not make any distinctions in his perception, but had an even m ind.

original: 'di ltar ne tso'i skyes ba'i rabs las khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ne tso'i skyes ba'i rabs las khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood from the Jataka of the Parrot.

original: 'di dag ni bzod pa las byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
analyzed: 'di dag ni bzod pa las byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
translated: These are the six param itas of patience.

original: de la phan 'dogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /üîΩ'od srung las tshangs par spyod pa spyad nas rnyed pa @77b dang / bkur stis dam pa'i chos nub par ma gyur cig ces yongs su bsngos pa dang / sangs rgyas 'od srung la bram ze'i bu skar 'od skyong gis rang gi lus kyi gos dang /
analyzed: de la phan 'dogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na / 'od srung las tshangs par spyod pa spyad nas rnyed pa @77b dang / bkur stis dam pa'i chos nub par ma gyur cig ces yongs su bsngos pa dang / sangs rgyas 'od srung la bram ze'i bu skar 'od skyong gis rang gi lus kyi gos dang /
translated: What are the six paramitas of benefit?üîΩThe param ita of giving ‚Äúof benefit‚Äù is the giving of the monk Kasyapa, who, having practiced pure conduct, dedicated his merit, saying, ‚ÄúMay the holy Dharma not disappear because of gain and honor.‚Äù

original: me tog sar ba lnga dang / me tog rnying pa lnga po dag gis mngon par bkab ste /
analyzed: me tog sar ba lnga dang / me tog rnying pa lnga po dag gis mngon par bkab ste /
translated: The param ita of morality ‚Äúof benefit‚Äù is the moral practice of the brahm in boy Tishya, who, having given his body to the Buddha Kasyapa, covered him w ith five new flowers and five old flowers.

original: gang gi rnam par smin pas lo lnga brgyar dam pa'i chos dang / lo lnga brgyar dam pa'i chos kyi gzugs brnyan yang 'bar ba gang yin pa de ni phan 'dogs pas yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi rnam par smin pas lo lnga brgyar dam pa'i chos dang / lo lnga brgyar dam pa'i chos kyi gzugs brnyan yang 'bar ba gang yin pa de ni phan 'dogs pas yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of generosity dedicated to benefit is the generosity whose maturation is that for five hundred years the true Dharma blazes and for five hundred years the reflection of the true Dharma blazes.

original: gzhan gyi tshul khrims 'chal ba sel bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims ni /üîΩdper na skye mched ma tshang ba gtong ba lta bu gang yin pa de ni phan 'dogs pas yongs su bsngos pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshul khrims 'chal ba sel bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims ni / dper na skye mched ma tshang ba gtong ba lta bu gang yin pa de ni phan 'dogs pas yongs su bsngos pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of morality dedicated to benefit is the morality that removes the immorality of others.üîΩFor example, it is like giving up an incomplete sense base.

original: sdug bsngal thob kyang sgyid lug pa med pa ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thob kyang sgyid lug pa med pa ni /
translated: The perfection of patience dedicated to benefit is the patience of one who is not discouraged even when suffering is obtained.

original: dper na 'gron pa'i ched du rgya mtsho chen po'i nang du chu srin ma ka ra'i thad du phyin pa dang / 'brog dang chu'i nang du khru brgya tsam du song ba'i bzod pa gang yin pa de ni phan 'dogs pas yongs su bsngos pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //üîΩlha dang mi'i ris kyi phun sum tshogs pa sgrub par 'gyur ba'i brtson 'grus ni /
analyzed: dper na 'gron pa'i ched du rgya mtsho chen po'i nang du chu srin ma ka ra'i thad du phyin pa dang / 'brog dang chu'i nang du khru brgya tsam du song ba'i bzod pa gang yin pa de ni phan 'dogs pas yongs su bsngos pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o // lha dang mi'i ris kyi phun sum tshogs pa sgrub par 'gyur ba'i brtson 'grus ni /
translated: The perfection of patience dedicated to benefiting others is like the patience of the great man who went a hundred fathoms into the water and the jungle for the sake of the travelers, and of the man who went into the great ocean to the makaras for the sake of the travelers.

original: dper na brgya byin gyis gsol ba btab pas bram ze chen po kin tu zhes bya bas sems can rnams mtho ris su bkye ba gang yin pa de @78a *//üîΩni phan 'dogs pas yongs su bsngos pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: dper na brgya byin gyis gsol ba btab pas bram ze chen po kin tu zhes bya bas sems can rnams mtho ris su bkye ba gang yin pa de @78a *// ni phan 'dogs pas yongs su bsngos pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of effort dedicated to benefiting others is like the effort of the great brahman Kin-tu, who, at the request of Indra, brought sentient beings to the higher realms.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la sangs rgyas kyis len pa med par bsgrags pa'i bsam gtan ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la sangs rgyas kyis len pa med par bsgrags pa'i bsam gtan ni /
translated: The perfection of meditation dedicated to benefiting others is like the meditation of the bodhisattva who was proclaimed by the Buddha to be without grasping.

original: dper na byang chub sems dpa' ston par gyur pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams tshangs pa'i 'jig rten dang / 'od gsal nas 'du shes med pa'i skye mched kyi bar du bkod pa gang yin pa de ni phan 'dogs pas yongs su bsngos pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: dper na byang chub sems dpa' ston par gyur pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams tshangs pa'i 'jig rten dang / 'od gsal nas 'du shes med pa'i skye mched kyi bar du bkod pa gang yin pa de ni phan 'dogs pas yongs su bsngos pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: For example, the perfection of concentration dedicated by the bodhisattva who has become a teacher to the benefit of the bodhisattvas who have been placed in the world of Brahma, in Abhasvara, up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: sems can rnams kyi ched du byas pa ni /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi ched du byas pa ni /
translated: That which is done for the sake of sentient beings is

original: dper na rgyal po byams thob dang / rgyal po mig bzang dang / rgyal po'i bu chos 'dod kyis 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams rab tu sgrog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: dper na rgyal po byams thob dang / rgyal po mig bzang dang / rgyal po'i bu chos 'dod kyis 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams rab tu sgrog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: the perfection of wisdom of the king Maitribala, the king Sunetra, and the prince DharmakƒÅma, which proclaims the mundane and supramundane dharmas and the paths of the ten virtues.

original: 'dir skyes pa'i rabs mang po nas khong du chud par bya ba gang yin pa de ni phan 'dogs pas yongs su bsngos pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir skyes pa'i rabs mang po nas khong du chud par bya ba gang yin pa de ni phan 'dogs pas yongs su bsngos pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Here, the perfection of wisdom dedicated to benefit, which is to be understood from the many jƒÅtakas, is

original: 'di dag ni phan 'dogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
analyzed: 'di dag ni phan 'dogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
translated: These are the six perfections of benefit.

original: 'phags pa bskal pa bzang po pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo //
analyzed: 'phags pa bskal pa bzang po pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo //
translated: Noble Ones of the Fortunate Eon, Great Vehicle S≈´tra

original: bam po lnga pa //
analyzed: bam po lnga pa //
translated: Chapter Five

original: de la phan mi 'dogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la phan mi 'dogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six perfections of non-benefit?

original: yid sngon du 'gro ba'i sems kyis 'dod @78b pa'i yon tan la 'jug pa'i sbyin pa dmigs pa dang bcas par yongs su bsngos pa gang yin pa de ni phan mi 'dogs pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: yid sngon du 'gro ba'i sems kyis 'dod @78b pa'i yon tan la 'jug pa'i sbyin pa dmigs pa dang bcas par yongs su bsngos pa gang yin pa de ni phan mi 'dogs pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of non-beneficial giving is the giving of one who engages in the sense pleasures with a mind preceded by the mind, fully dedicated with reference points.

original: dper na mar me mdzad la me tog autpal lnga phul ba dang / rnam par smin pa thams cad du mi 'byung ba dang / gang dam pa'i chos nub par 'gyur ba de ni phan mi 'dogs pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: dper na mar me mdzad la me tog autpal lnga phul ba dang / rnam par smin pa thams cad du mi 'byung ba dang / gang dam pa'i chos nub par 'gyur ba de ni phan mi 'dogs pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: For example, offering five utpala flowers to Dƒ´pa·πÉkara, not arising in any ripening, and when the true Dharma will disappear, that is the perfection of non-beneficial giving.

original: thabs mkhas pa med cing dngos po'i 'du shes can gyi tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni phan mi 'dogs pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa med cing dngos po'i 'du shes can gyi tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni phan mi 'dogs pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of morality which is without skill in means and has the notion of entities is the perfection of morality which does not benefit.

original: ro myang ba cung zad tsam gyi phyir sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni phan mi 'dogs pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ro myang ba cung zad tsam gyi phyir sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni phan mi 'dogs pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of patience which is indifferent to suffering for the sake of a mere little taste is the perfection of patience which does not benefit.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos dang rab tu ldan pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni phan mi 'dogs pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos dang rab tu ldan pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni phan mi 'dogs pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of effort which is associated with mundane dharmas is the perfection of effort which does not benefit.

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten kyi tshe'i mthas gtugs pa srid kyi bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni phan mi 'dogs pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten kyi tshe'i mthas gtugs pa srid kyi bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni phan mi 'dogs pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of concentration which is limited to the life-span of the Brahma world is the perfection of concentration which does not benefit.

original: ma bsgrags pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: ma bsgrags pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of wisdom which is not proclaimed is the perfection of wisdom which does not benefit.

original: dper na de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs shing bshad pa na chos de snyed cig bsgrags shing bshad la /
analyzed: dper na de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs shing bshad pa na chos de snyed cig bsgrags shing bshad la /
translated: For example, when the TathƒÅgata teaches and explains, he proclaims and explains as many dharmas as there are.

original: chos ji snyed lus la de snyed cig ma @79a *//
analyzed: chos ji snyed lus la de snyed cig ma @79a *//
translated: As many dharmas as there are in the body, that many are not proclaimed.

original: bsgrags pa de ni phan mi 'dogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: bsgrags pa de ni phan mi 'dogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: That is the perfection of wisdom that does not benefit.

original: de dag thams cad kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dam pa'i chos nub par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dam pa'i chos nub par blta bar bya ste /
translated: All of them should be seen as the holy Dharma of complete nirvƒÅ·πáa that has set.

original: 'di dag ni phan mi 'dogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
analyzed: 'di dag ni phan mi 'dogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
translated: These are the six perfections that do not benefit.

original: de la lhag ma dang bcas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la lhag ma dang bcas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six perfections that have a remainder?

original: sngon mar me mdzad la byang chub sems dpas sbyin pa phul ba gang yin pa de ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sngon mar me mdzad la byang chub sems dpas sbyin pa phul ba gang yin pa de ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of generosity that has a remainder is the generosity that the Bodhisattva offered to Dƒ´pa·πÉkara in the past.

original: lus dang ngag lhag par lhag ma dang bcas shing mi mos pa mang la bdag tu dmigs pa dmigs pa la gnas pa'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag lhag par lhag ma dang bcas shing mi mos pa mang la bdag tu dmigs pa dmigs pa la gnas pa'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of morality with remainder is the morality of one who is not yet free from the desire for the body and speech, who has many desires, who is not yet free from the desire for the object of attention, and who is still attached to the notion of self.

original: so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis nges par 'byung ba'i bzod pa gang yin pa de ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis nges par 'byung ba'i bzod pa gang yin pa de ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of patience with remainder is the patience of one who has not yet attained the patience of the Dharma of non-arising, but who has attained the patience of the Dharma through the power of discernment.

original: bar chad dang bar chad med par gnas pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad dang bar chad med par gnas pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of effort with remainder is the effort of one who has not yet attained the effort of the bodhisattva who is irreversible, but who has attained the effort of one who abides in the stages of abiding and non-backsliding.

original: dmigs pa la dmigs pa'i bsam gtan gang yin pa de ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa la dmigs pa'i bsam gtan gang yin pa de ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of meditation with remainder is the meditation of one who has not yet attained the meditation of the bodhisattva who is irreversible, but who has attained the meditation of one who is skilled in the means of the stages.

original: thos pa'i bdag nyid dang / bsams pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes rab gang yin pa de ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'i shes rab kyi pha @79b rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa'i bdag nyid dang / bsams pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes rab gang yin pa de ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'i shes rab kyi pha @79b rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom that is the nature of hearing and the nature of reflection is the perfection of wisdom with remainder.

original: rgyu gang gis na gnas kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob ce na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis na gnas kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob ce na /
translated: By what cause does one obtain the name of perfection of the basis?

original: kha phyir phyogs pa la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rnam par smin pa med la /
analyzed: kha phyir phyogs pa la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rnam par smin pa med la /
translated: In the outward-facing [stage], there is no ripening of the teachings of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub kyi 'byor pa'ang med de /
analyzed: byang chub kyi 'byor pa'ang med de /
translated: and there is no wealth of enlightenment.

original: de dag ni sa bcu las ldog pa'i chos su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ni sa bcu las ldog pa'i chos su shes par bya ste /
translated: Those should be understood as the teachings of turning back from the ten grounds.

original: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
translated: These are the bodhisattvas' six perfections with remainder.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i lhag ma med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i lhag ma med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the bodhisattvas' six perfections without remainder?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu thams cad 'khor bar yongs su bsngo ba ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu thams cad 'khor bar yongs su bsngo ba ste /
translated: The result of the perfection of generosity is dedicated to sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: dper na rang sangs rgyas bdun brgya la sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni lhag ma med pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: dper na rang sangs rgyas bdun brgya la sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni lhag ma med pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: For example, any generosity to seven hundred pratyekabuddhas is the perfection of generosity without remainder.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni lhag ma med pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni lhag ma med pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Any morality that is not separated from the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of morality without remainder.

original: ngan song du skye bas 'jigs pa'i bzod pa gang yin pa de ni lhag ma med pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ngan song du skye bas 'jigs pa'i bzod pa gang yin pa de ni lhag ma med pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Any patience that is afraid of being reborn in the lower realms is the perfection of patience without remainder.

original: bdud kyi las kyis kun nas dkris pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni lhag ma med pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi las kyis kun nas dkris pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni lhag ma med pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Any effort that is completely bound up with the activities of Mara is the perfection of effort without remainder.

original: tshe'i tshad kyi mthar thug pa'i bsam gtan gang yin pa de ni lhag ma med pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: tshe'i tshad kyi mthar thug pa'i bsam gtan gang yin pa de ni lhag ma med pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Any concentration that reaches the limit of the life-span is the perfection of concentration without remainder.

original: lta ba sngon du 'gro zhing sdug bsngal spong ba la mos pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni lhag ma med pa'i shes rab @80a *//
analyzed: lta ba sngon du 'gro zhing sdug bsngal spong ba la mos pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni lhag ma med pa'i shes rab @80a *//
translated: The wisdom that is preceded by the view and that is dedicated to the elimination of suffering is the wisdom that is without remainder.üîΩ

original: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The wisdom that is preceded by the view and that is dedicated to the elimination of suffering is the perfection of wisdom without remainder.

original: de ci'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob ce na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob ce na /
translated: Why are they called perfections?

original: de dag ni byang chub thob pa 'jig rten pa dang mthun par spyod pa des na; pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob ste /
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub thob pa 'jig rten pa dang mthun par spyod pa des na; pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob ste /
translated: Because they are practiced in accordance with the world in order to attain enlightenment, they are called perfections.

original: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i lhag ma med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i lhag ma med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
translated: These are the bodhisattvas‚Äô six perfections without remainder.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rig pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /

translated: ‚ÄúWhat are the bodhisattvas‚Äô six perfections of knowledge?

original: bla ma rnams la re ba med par sbyin pa gang gi rnam par smin pas bskal pa stong du 'jig rten pa'i zang zing la spyod cing gnas kyang lus kyi mthu nyams pa med pa gang yin pa de ni rig pa yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'i pha
analyzed: bla ma rnams la re ba med par sbyin pa gang gi rnam par smin pas bskal pa stong du 'jig rten pa'i zang zing la spyod cing gnas kyang lus kyi mthu nyams pa med pa gang yin pa de ni rig pa yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'i pha
translated: The giving that is dedicated to knowledge is the giving that, due to its maturation, allows one to enjoy and remain in the world for a thousand eons without the power of one‚Äôs body diminishing. This is the perfection of giving of knowledge.

analyzed: gang gis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rdzogs par byang chub pa'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni rig pa yongs su bsngos pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //

original: lam la gnas pa'i sgrib pa lnga rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ba'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni rig pa yongs su bsngos pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: lam la gnas pa'i sgrib pa lnga rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ba'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni rig pa yongs su bsngos pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of knowledge.üîΩIt is

original: @80b byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas lha'i mig dang / sngon gyi gnas rig pa 'thob par 'gyur ba'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni rig pa yongs su bsngos pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: @80b byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas lha'i mig dang / sngon gyi gnas rig pa 'thob par 'gyur ba'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni rig pa yongs su bsngos pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The param ita of m editation ‚Äúdedicated to knowledge‚Äù is the param ita of m editation that, through the enlightenm ent of perfect Buddhahood, attains the eye of the gods and the knowledge of the previous lives.

original: zag pa zad par byed pa sangs rgyas kyi spyan 'thob par 'gyur la rtag tu chos thams cad mngon du snang bar 'gyur ba'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni rig pa yongs su bsngos pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa zad par byed pa sangs rgyas kyi spyan 'thob par 'gyur la rtag tu chos thams cad mngon du snang bar 'gyur ba'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni rig pa yongs su bsngos pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The param ita of w isdom ‚Äúdedicated to knowledge‚Äù is the w isdom that, through the extinction of the defilem ents, attains the eye of the Buddha and is always manifest in all things.

original: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i rig pa yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i rig pa yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
translated: These are the six param itas of the Bodhisattva dedicated to knowledge.

original: de la rig pa'i khyad pa la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rig pa'i khyad pa la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six paramitas of abiding in the special knowledge?

original: gang gis dam pa'i chos gnas par byed cing bstan pa la 'jug pa'i chos gnas pa gang yin pa de ni rig pa'i khyad par la gnas pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis dam pa'i chos gnas par byed cing bstan pa la 'jug pa'i chos gnas pa gang yin pa de ni rig pa'i khyad par la gnas pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of generosity of one who abides in the distinction of knowledge is that by which the holy Dharma abides and the Dharma that enters the teaching abides.

original: gang na de bzhin gshegs pa bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba dang bral ba tha na lus kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / ngag gi rnam par rtog pa med pa gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang na de bzhin gshegs pa bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba dang bral ba tha na lus kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / ngag gi rnam par rtog pa med pa gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: The perfection of morality is that by which the Tathagata, free from the connection of propensities, has no conceptual thoughts of body or speech.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos las rtog pa med pa gang yin pa de ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos las rtog pa med pa gang yin pa de ni bzod pa'o //
translated: The perfection of patience is that by which one is not conceptualized in worldly dharmas.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis zil gyis ma non pas mya ngan las 'das pa ji srid bar dus thams cad pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis zil gyis ma non pas mya ngan las 'das pa ji srid bar dus thams cad pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: The perfection of effort is that effort which is for all time, until the end of samsara, not overcome by the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems @81a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems @81a *//
translated: The perfection of meditation is that by which one knows the thoughts of all beings.

original: kyi rnams grangs shes shing sgra la rtog pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: kyi rnams grangs shes shing sgra la rtog pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of meditative stability is the meditative stability of one who knows the number of syllables and who understands the sounds.

original: dus shes pa las mi 'da' zhing bdag yongs su grol bar byed pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni rig pa'i khyad par la gnas pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: dus shes pa las mi 'da' zhing bdag yongs su grol bar byed pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni rig pa'i khyad par la gnas pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the wisdom of one who does not transgress the knowledge of time and who liberates himself.

original: 'di dag ni rig pa'i khyad par la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rig pa'i khyad par la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
translated: These are the six perfections of abiding in the distinction of knowledge.

original: de la sangs rgyas 'byung ba phun sum tshogs par byed pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas 'byung ba phun sum tshogs par byed pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six perfections that bring about the perfection of the appearance of the Buddha?

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i dus na longs spyod chen por 'gyur zhing tshad med pa gzung ba'i phyir gang 'phags pa rnams la sbyin pa byin pa gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba phun sum tshogs par byed pa'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i dus na longs spyod chen por 'gyur zhing tshad med pa gzung ba'i phyir gang 'phags pa rnams la sbyin pa byin pa gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba phun sum tshogs par byed pa'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: The generosity that brings about the perfection of the appearance of the Buddha is the generosity of one who, at the time of the appearance of the Buddha, becomes of great wealth and gives to the noble ones in order to grasp the immeasurable.

original: thar par yongs su bsngos shing nyon mongs pa zad par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: thar par yongs su bsngos shing nyon mongs pa zad par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is the morality of one who has dedicated himself to liberation and who is intent on eliminating the defilements and on the appearance of the Buddhas.

original: ston pa mngon sum du gyur pa na sbyangs pa'i yon tan la skyo ba med par 'gyur ba'i bzod pa ni /
analyzed: ston pa mngon sum du gyur pa na sbyangs pa'i yon tan la skyo ba med par 'gyur ba'i bzod pa ni /
translated: Patience is the patience of one who is not wearied by the ascetic practices when the Master is present.

original: dper na 'od srung chen po'i lta bu gang yin pa de ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: dper na 'od srung chen po'i lta bu gang yin pa de ni bzod pa'o //
translated: It is like the patience of Mahakasyapa.

original: smon lam dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus ni /
analyzed: smon lam dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus ni /
translated: Exertion is the exertion of one who has vows.

original: dper na rgyal po bsod nams 'phags kyi lta bu gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: dper na rgyal po bsod nams 'phags kyi lta bu gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: It is like the exertion of King Punyabhadra.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa la dmigs pa'i bsam @81b gtan gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa la dmigs pa'i bsam @81b gtan gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan no //
translated: Meditation is the meditation of one who has the Buddha in mind.

original: nges par 'byed pas yongs su bsngos pa'i shes rab ni /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pas yongs su bsngos pa'i shes rab ni /
translated: Wisdom is the wisdom of one who has dedicated himself to the penetration of the truths.

original: dper na sangs rgyas 'od srung gi tshe lnga po dag gi lta bu gang yin pa de ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: dper na sangs rgyas 'od srung gi tshe lnga po dag gi lta bu gang yin pa de ni shes rab ste /
translated: It is like the wisdom of the five hundred disciples of Buddha Kashyapa.

original: 'di dag ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba phun sum tshogs par byed pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
analyzed: 'di dag ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba phun sum tshogs par byed pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
translated: These are the six perfections for making the appearance of the Buddha perfect.

original: de la dran pa nyams pa med par byed pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dran pa nyams pa med par byed pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six perfections for not having a lapse of memory?

original: gzhan gyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin pa'o //
translated: The giving that gives according to the wishes of others is the giving.

original: lus dang ngag yongs su srung ba nye bar sgrub pa la brtson pa'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: lus dang ngag yongs su srung ba nye bar sgrub pa la brtson pa'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality that is the effort to protect body and speech is the morality.

original: dam pa'i chos nub pa'i dus su yi dam brtan pa zab mo la bzod pa las nges par 'byung ba'i bzod pa gang yin pa de ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nub pa'i dus su yi dam brtan pa zab mo la bzod pa las nges par 'byung ba'i bzod pa gang yin pa de ni bzod pa'o //
translated: The patience that is the patience of the profound vow of the Dharma at the time of the disappearance of the Dharma is the patience.

original: nye bar sgrub pa la brtson pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: nye bar sgrub pa la brtson pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: The effort that is the effort to accomplish is the effort.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas yongs su bzung ba'i bsam gtan gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas yongs su bzung ba'i bsam gtan gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan no //
translated: The concentration that is the concentration of the emptiness aspect is the concentration.

original: yid mi bde bas rab tu phye ba'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: yid mi bde bas rab tu phye ba'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni shes rab ste /
translated: Wisdom is the wisdom that is distinguished by mental unhappiness.

original: 'di dag ni dran pa nyams pa med par byed pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
analyzed: 'di dag ni dran pa nyams pa med par byed pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
translated: These are the six perfections for not losing mindfulness.

original: de la sangs rgyas 'byung ba rab tu 'thob pa khyim gyi dngos po la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas 'byung ba rab tu 'thob pa khyim gyi dngos po la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six perfections for obtaining the appearance of the Buddha, while remaining in the householder‚Äôs state?

original: yan lag lnga phun sum tshogs pa'i sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: yan lag lnga phun sum tshogs pa'i sbyin pa ste /
translated: Giving is the giving that is endowed with five limbs.

original: lnga gang zhe na /üîΩstan phun sum tshogs pa dang / yul @82a *//
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na / stan phun sum tshogs pa dang / yul @82a *//
translated: What are the five?

original: phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'dod par bya ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / chags par bya ba phun sum tshogs pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'dod par bya ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / chags par bya ba phun sum tshogs pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of seat, the perfection of country, the perfection of retinue, the perfection of what is to be desired, and the perfection of what is to be attached to.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is the morality of non-attachment.

original: sems can du 'du shes pa spangs pa'i bzod pa gang yin pa de ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: sems can du 'du shes pa spangs pa'i bzod pa gang yin pa de ni bzod pa'o //
translated: Patience is the patience of abandoning the notion of sentient beings.

original: mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: The effort that is the realization of the equality of all things is effort.

original: mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'i sems smon pa med pa la dmigs pa'i bsam gtan gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan no //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'i sems smon pa med pa la dmigs pa'i bsam gtan gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan no //
translated: The concentration that is the realization of the equality of all things, the concentration that is focused on the aspirationless and signless state of mind, is concentration.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i tshul gyis nges par 'byung ba'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i tshul gyis nges par 'byung ba'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni shes rab ste /
translated: The wisdom that is the realization of the truth of the noble ones is wisdom.

original: 'di dag ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba rab tu 'thob pa'i khyim gyi dngos po la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
analyzed: 'di dag ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba rab tu 'thob pa'i khyim gyi dngos po la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
translated: These are the six pƒÅramitƒÅs of the one who is established in the state of the household in order to attain the appearance of the Buddha.

original: de la nges par 'byung ba sgrub pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nges par 'byung ba sgrub pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat are the six pƒÅramitƒÅs of the accomplishment of deliverance?

original: zag pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin pa'o //
translated: The generosity that is not associated with the generosity of the uncontaminated is generosity.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality that is associated with nirvƒÅ·πáa is morality.

original: khams gsum gyis yid byung ba'i bzod pa gang yin pa de ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum gyis yid byung ba'i bzod pa gang yin pa de ni bzod pa'o //
translated: The patience that is the disgust of the three realms is patience.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa las nges par byung ba'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus @82b so //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa las nges par byung ba'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus @82b so //
translated: The effort that arises from the close mindfulnesses is effort.

original: byams pa la gnas shing srid pa la smod par gnas pa'i bsam gtan gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan no //
analyzed: byams pa la gnas shing srid pa la smod par gnas pa'i bsam gtan gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan no //
translated: The concentration that abides in love and abides in the condemnation of existence is concentration.

original: yid mi bde bas rab tu phye ba'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: yid mi bde bas rab tu phye ba'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni shes rab ste /
translated: The wisdom that is distinguished by mental unhappiness is wisdom.

original: 'di dag ni nges par 'byung ba sgrub pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
analyzed: 'di dag ni nges par 'byung ba sgrub pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
translated: These are the six pƒÅramitƒÅs of accomplishing renunciation.

original: de la mang du thos pa sgrub pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mang du thos pa sgrub pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six pƒÅramitƒÅs of accomplishing much learning?

original: gdams ngag dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin pa'o //
